Reviews.Title: “Great place, not so great location.”
Reviews.Author: E W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, the service was fantastic and the rooms were great for the price. I didn't have the breakfast there so I can't comment. My main issue is the location, which is not very appealing if you are a tourist on holiday. It's quite a lowly looking area and even though it's close to the Eiffel tower there isn't anything around there like restaurants or shops or anything really.

Reviews.Title: “Carina Hotel, Paris. Very close to the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: 85Alan
Reviews.Content: Decent little hotel, basic but clean and tidy whicc is all you can ask for on a low budget. Locatin was good, 5 - 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel tower and was close to an underground station which was handy as we jumped on the train from the airport. Within an hour of landing I was stood at the reception of the hotel. There were a few bars and resteraunts close by, even a McDonalds for those who eat that sort of food. I would go to this hotel again due to its price and good base location. We travelled to Paris in April and the weather was very very hot, very surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesgoconnor
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The hotel was very central and spotlessly clean. Great value for money and i would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel have a good quality. the proximity from eiffel tower and underground is good. The personnal is sympathic. But the morning they haven't hot water in the bathroom; and breakfast have less choice.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night during our weekend trip to Paris, it's bit far from the city centre, about 20min to half an hour walk to Eiffel Tower. No hot water for shower, the staff wasn't keen to talk to you. Room is clean but no English Channels

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The bedroom and ensuite were really lovely; however the bedroom, with its African theme was actually much darker than I like a room to be. I prefer a bright airy room. I understood from my booking that I had booked Bed and Breakfast but discoivered that breakfast was not included which was very disappointing. I would have very much appreciated tea making facilities in the room particularly as I was ill during my stay and spent a lot of time in my room. A big disappointment was that the advertised 'free wifi' did not work at any time in the bedroom. I felt this hotel was expensive for not including breakfast and no tea making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel located in a very central position within Paris. ONLY Problem is parking, it Tool me a hour to find a parking Spot. It is near to Tour Eiffel, very quiet. Rooms are very nice, new and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Marty K
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to the Eiffel Tower and found this one to be a very comfortable and reasonable hotel. Rooms are clean, bathroom is excellent and staff are very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast is excellent value. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Paris for long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jennyj41
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. It was a short walk to the eifel tower and also to the metros. Lovely superb and great cafes, bars and shops on our doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shang_Chia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a mere 15 min walk to Eiffel Tower and within walking distance of at least 4 train stations. There are also a few convenience stores and French and Japanese eateries around the block. The neighborhood is quiet and feels very safe at night. The hotel staff generously gave out free wifi passwords to enable us to access the Internet using our laptop an iPhones. Room is clean and bed is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: - The Location was amazing. It was a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and close to many restaurants/café's The Metro station Charles Michels was about a 2 minute walk The lovely lady at the reception desk was very helpful & pleasant. She even checked to see if our room was ready because we arrived before check-in time. - The room was not very big but comfortable enough for 2 adults. . Good enough for a short stay. It was also very clean and cosy . We have recommended this place to several friends, no one hs been disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Peacefull Hotel in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Choupito
Reviews.Content: hi, i discovered this very quind and peacefull hotel in Paris. It's near from the effel tower and on very fast access of Paris Center with the metro :) Its a very nice and charming hotel, with a good self service breakfast. There is all you need and more ! Near of the hotel there is a lot of restaurants, shops, on the commerce street. Best regards to Mr David

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Rex009
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Oct 2011. Hotel is conveniently located. Everything is good but beware of bed bugs! I was bitten on my legs and neck.

Reviews.Title: “A great hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: DebbyL25
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carina for 2 nights in October 2011. Fantastic hotel. The room wasn't huge but was more than adequate, with comfy beds, very quiet & peaceful, lots of clothes hanging space, free wifi & a safe which was free of charge to use. Bathroom was very small & could have used a bit of new grout but the shower was powerful. Only gripe was they'd only left one bath towel in a room with two people staying. Hotel isn't quite as near the Eiffel Tower as they makes out but it is about 15-20 minute walk. Very convenient for the metro which is a 2 minute walk away. Staff were friendly & helpful at all times. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good money for value”
Reviews.Author: Ali2H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a weekend. The hotel's location is quite good i a nice residential area, 2 minutes from mtero station Charles Michel, but not too far on foot from Grenelle station. The room was good and comfortable, just a bit small, but well its paris! The bathroom with a tub was nice, and the breakfast was fine. The personnel was just slightly unfriendly at times, but it wasnt really that bad. All in all i would recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: denniskapoor
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within minutes walk to Charles Michels metro and 10min walk to Eiffel. Fruits/Confectionary shop/bakery round the corner Stayed in room 12. Newly renovated/clean and tidy. Avg size room which can be helped with some more lighting. Small LCD with only english channel as CNN. Bathroom was in excellent condition. Looked newly renovated and was very spacious with a large bathtub and very hot water. Relaxing after entire day of walking. Buffet breakfast with croissant/break/yogurt/orange juice/coffee/tea/boiled eggs. On the sweeter side and little bit boring if u stay over 2 nights. Excellent quality however. Iron/Internet/free wifi avlble in the hotel. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in good location”
Reviews.Author: atducat
Reviews.Content: Clean and cozy (rather small), 15 min from Eiffel tower. Friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised for a second time”
Reviews.Author: SpachNZ
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in this hotel with my husband in September 2009. On a recent business trip to Paris I decided to return to this hotel. Though the hotel is small, the rooms are very tidy and clean. The bathroom was large - almost the same size as the bedroom! I received a very warm welcome from the receptionist. The breakfast is simple, but sufficient. Some of the reception staff did not speak English well, but I was always able to get what I wanted. The location is good. You are less than 5 mins from the Charles Michels metro station, so it is very easy to get around Paris. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower in about 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Walty55
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with a very proffesionnal team!! Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Good journey in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica_3612
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two children during three days. I booked here for the proximity with the Tower Eiffel. The room are big and the bathroom too. All are clean. If I return in Paris I will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexia02
Reviews.Content: Very nice room...small but that is the norm for Paris. I was surprised how big the bathroom was. Lots of hot water for the shower and extremely clean. The breakfasts were very nice. The hotel does provide computers for internet access. I would definitely stay here if I am ever in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marc41
Reviews.Content: stayed my daughter for two days. the rooms were very clean and comfortable. good breakfast. bathrooms looked newly. and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, unclean hotel and not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: raj_arian52
Reviews.Content: This is a very dirty, narrow and hot hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights and I must say our stay was not very pleasant. First of all the room we stayed has not been renovated in the last 20 years I think. The bed cover was filthy and some parts are not stitched properly. The extra blanket was full of dust and the blanket spread over the bed was also darty and spotted. The breakfast was just simple with croissant, juice, butter, jam, tea, coffee, fruits and supply of bakery is inadequate (you might have to wait for 20 mins for a croissant). The housekeepers do not know how to do the beds. On top of that we had a chunky old TV in our room which shows 2-3 channels. Complementary toiletries are inadequately supplied. The reception staffs are not very helpful and some of them do not speak English properly. Lifts is very small and can’t fit more than 2 people at time. We paid 126 euro per night and the service we got in return was very poor. Good things about this hotel are very near from metro station, toilet is newly renovated and big, 25 mins walk from Eiffel tower. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you get a better hotel in the same price please do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but a trustworthy 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: VladAlexandru
Reviews.Content: Being in Paris this hotel is a good value for money. 15 min walk from Tour Eiffel and 5 min from Metro. Not great but a trustworthy 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, dirty, shabby- what a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireMiller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor. When I walked in the room, I knew I could not stay there. I immediately looked for another hotel. I don't know how this hotel earned good reviews unless I was given the 1 bad room in hotel that they rarely rented. The room looked as if nothing had been done to it for 50 years. The wallpaper was faded and discolored and looked like it had mold in the corners. In the closet, it had pulled away from the wall displaying a hole in the wall. The carpet was tattered, the bed was lumpy. There was mold in the bathroom shower. The desk clerk was polite and the hotel was in a good location, but that did not make up for the room. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just lovely”
Reviews.Author: L0chness
Reviews.Content: really nice sized room. great shower and had bathtub staff was good downstairs and there 24/7 excellant location..close to eiffel tower(15min walk) and metro station(5min walk).

Reviews.Title: “Location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: cheddyanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for three days Great location for walking to various sights. The rooms were comfortable and clean and good breakfast. Only disappoinment was no WIFI as advertised. Apparently not working, but they were not in a hurry to fix the problem. Still, good value for money and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 3*, very comfy, very clean, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Poderosa_83
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 nights, but had a very pleasant stay. Beds were very comfortable, bathrooms looked newly fitted and very modern. Room was a little hot, but the weather was particularly hot when we were there (35 C plus!) Probably a bit longer than 10 mins walk to Eiffel Tower, but only 5 from a metro station that gets you everywhere! Will use again in the future I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jennibub
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my moher for four nights and rate the hotel highly. We were made to feel very welcome with English speaking staff at reception. The rooms are a reasonable size, I have heard some horror stories regarding how small hotel rooms can be but this was completely adequate for two people. Enough wardrobe space and shelving to house our clothing for the both of us. The bathroom seemed new and was a good size with a fitted shower. Towels are changed daily and the room is tidied and cleaned daily too. Wifi access is free in each room, a passcode from reception is required for 24h access. The hotel is within walking distance of the eiffel tower, although the tower does look closer than it actually is!!! The metro is just a 3 -4 min walk away and using the metro is very easy, from here you can reach all the famous landmarks within 20 minutes. All in all we had a great time and when I return to Paris I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but excellent value, in great location”
Reviews.Author: ar85
Reviews.Content: Paris is phenomenally expensive for us Brits now the pound in roughly equivalent to the Euro, and so all hotels seem very expensive for what they are. Keeping this mind, the Hotel Carina is excellent value. We paid about £75 on lastminute.com, which included breakfast (nothing special but perfectly adequate). The rooms were small but clean and had everything you need for a couple of days. The best thing about this hotel is the location: a couple of minutes walk from the metro, 20 mins walk from the eiffel tower, and with plenty of good places to eat and drink within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: Donnit
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff, clean room, 2 minute walk to metro, 10-15 minutes walk to Eiffel tower. Plenty of restaurants, small supermarket, banks and chemist. Very pleased we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsVintage
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights. Good location. Near metro Charles Michels, and 15mins walk to the Tower Eiffels. But I am surprised it has walling outside. When we did check in, very "simple" , told them yr names and gave you a key. I asked for is there any room can viewing little Tower Eiffels? Then they said one can see little....but when we got into the room on 4th floor, we cannot see the Tower, just the window in toilet is broken, and someone outside our window,on the walling, we felt not secure, then we go down and ask for changing room. When we go down, they said the window has no problem. but we said we still wanna change, then they gave us another room on the same floor. also has walling. the window is fine, but 2 light bulks didn't work...I go down and told them. And asking for any operations phone line so that we need not to go up and down....but them the man asked "Why?"...I said nothing...and then went back my room. The toilet is really great and spacious too. I think though the French staff like this, but the hotel is worth to stay. If next time when I went to Paris, I think I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “jewel tones and big bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: booksandplants
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my father for three nights. We booked a weekend special rate through their website which worked out very well for us. It was a new area of Paris for us to stay in and for this trip it was a good base. The room was small but great for Paris and the bathroom was new and huge! Our room faced the street and got nice light in the morning. Hotel Carina was very near the metro, making it easy to get around. It was also a pleasant walk to the Eiffel Tower. There were two computers available for guests near the breakfast room and we used them often. The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful and accepted my attempts at French with good humor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely rooms, accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: doreneL
Reviews.Content: The room was a little small as all european hotels are, but very cute. Small office with 2 computers to use for FREE. Conveniently located 2 blocks away from metro stop, next to McDonalds (great coffee), excellent bakery, and a small grocery store. We ate inexpensively by utilizing the bakery (croissants, bagettes, sandwiches, patries), the local grocery store for water, cokes, and of course an assortment of cheeses for our bagettes. About 4-5 blocks away (nice evening walk) Restaurant Chez Thomas, great food and prices, not a tourist trap as trypical of many restaurants now in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HEATHER030
Reviews.Content: Not much to look at from the outside, so dont go on first impressions. The hotel itself is lovely, room small but perfectly adequate and very clean. Breakfast had plenty of choice and was very filling. Staff were brilliant, very friendly and very helpful. The location was great, right near to the metro, with lots of bars and restaurants and within easy walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samtailor
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a very central location, very close (200m) to charles michels metro station, but still in quiet surroundings. Many nearby restaurants and cafes, pharmacies and grocery stores. The staff were nice and could speak english. The rooms were kept clean, and towels changed everyday. breakfast was good and had a very good choice. The Carina Tour Eiffel is in my opinion very good value for money, Would stay there again, and would definetly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location, Value: Two Thumbs Up.”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterDallas
Reviews.Content: In Paris with my daughter. Given the location and price I doubt you will find a better two star hotel. No bells or whistles but great place still. I am an American and the staff were very friendly to us. One block from Charles Michel Metro; Easy access to all of Paris; less than 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and plenty of cafes and bakeries within a ston's throw if you want a late night snack. You can take the RER / Metro from and to CDG with only one change of station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: magda671
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the metro station. A 15min walk away from the Eiffel Tower. Rather small rooms, but considering Parisian standards I'd say they were ok. Delicious breakfast included. Lift but no restaurant. One of the better two star hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cntownsend
Reviews.Content: I surprised my girlfriend the night before flying out, telling her to pack a bag for a two night stay in the Carina Hotel, Paris. We arrived close to midnight but had no problems collecting our keys. Room and bathroom were on the small side but more than adequate. The toilet room, however, was built within a small corner of the bathroom and not nearly big enough. Shower was outstanding. Both were clean and recently refurbished on a budget to a satisfactory standard. One small cigarette hole in the curtain. Breakfast was basic (croissants, panne au chocolat, jams, juice, hot chocolate, coffee) but enjoyable and an English newspaper was found from a kiosk around the corner. The room was so cheap that we didn't expect anything grand but this newly decorated hotel was quite charming and offers pleasant accommodation on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & sympatico !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Choupito
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone ! I came at the carina with my girlfriend on August. It was a very charming trip, all the staff was very lovely with we, and the room very clean and nice. It's very close from the effeil tower so you can go walking. Que Viva Paris ! Besos a todos. Choupito :)

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place”
Reviews.Author: ryan41
Reviews.Content: I was pleased my wife and me to spend a wkend on this hotel. It was very useful to us to visit the eiffel tower and to travel along the "quai de seine". I think it is a very romantic place for a couple. Even if it is a 2stars hotel, the Breakfast is still good. If you want to adventure you in Paris with a hotel which is not far from monuments of paris, I think Carina hotel is a good choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: thegwada
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, my room was very neat, the personnel was very polite, the service was pleasant. I spent four wonderful days in Paris and the breakfast was copious.The Charles Michel metro station is only two minutes away ! I recommand it !

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff, poor room, cramped”
Reviews.Author: TravelMr
Reviews.Content: The official website for this hotel looks fantastic - http://www.carina-paris-hotel.com/index.html - but in reality, it is very disappointing. I paid for a double room, and arrived to find 2 single beds pushed together in a cramped room. The breakfast was simply bread and coffee. The hotel staff were rude and short with foreign visitors. When I got back to the UK I sent them a short email regarding the room and I received a homophobic reply and accusations of leaving the room in "such a mess inside and it was so dirty than even the roomaids could not do their job properly". This is completely untrue, I left the room clean and tidy. I was left with the impression that they dislike everyone who isn't French and are very stuck up. Never again. And "5 minutes away from the Eiffel Tower?!" Maybe on a motor bike.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireLeggy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights in October. The breakfast was your typical continental, which was nice. The room was excellent value for money with all the usual facilities but the main thing is it was very clean! there was lashings of hot water in the very large shower and it was quiet at night. The position of the hotel is very handy for the Eiffel Tower and near by attractions. I would reccommend this hotel if you just want somewhere to crash and have breakfast. The staff were friendly and let us check in, in the morning rather than waiting until two o'clock. Hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far West of other sights”
Reviews.Author: food4real1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 13th September for 1 night. The staff werent rude but they werent particulary friendly either. We probably only exchanged a few words and they didnt go out of their way to make us feel particulary welcome. Room was nice and clean, nice big bathroom, Rm 24. Bed was large and v comfy. We would have loved a kettle so we could atleast make a cuppa. Breaky was good but the usual continental. Not much spoken to us then either tho I got impression speaking English was a problem. Location wise, The Eiffel Tower is a 10min walk away from hotel, which is located in a residential area. Metro line quite close tho we didnt enjoy travelling on the Metro, hubby had his pocket picked by 2 young girls! BEWARE. Tour bus is great tho dont get a 2 day pass, 1 day is enough to see what you want and to get yr bearings. The white and green bus seemed better than the Red, which doesnt take you upto Sacre Coeur. We went straight to the Eiffel Tower next morning and there were only a handful of people in the queue, this was at 8.45am. We queued til 9.30 and then got straight into the tower. Weather was nice so waiting not an issue and was nice to have time to admire the views and to buy the keyrings they come and try to sell you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: AditiDubai_U_A_E
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 days' reservation confirmed at Hotel Carina, but with the change in our Train tickets we were reaching Paris a night before our confirmed booking. As we requested to extend our booking , we received a prompt reply stating that it would not be a problem at all. The night receptionist , a lady, was very efficient and though we checked in after midnight it was no trouble at all. Our room was on the ground floor , and as we were travelling light, luggage was no problem. The room was small but the bathroom very spacious and clean. Towels were changed daily and our beds were neatly done up when we returned to our hotel room after our sight seeing. David , who was at the reception was very helpful, and at our request , got us a booking at one of the major floor shows in the city. The Charles Mitchel metro stop is just a block away and with the Two days' Paris Pass we were able to make the most of our stay in Paris. The continental Breakfast was good, and I enjoyed my morning coffee with the croissants served , delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Small but Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: QawraKingpin
Reviews.Content: Greetings from Malta, I am sending this email to show our satisfaction for having stayed at the Hotel Carina for 3 days (13/7 - 16/7). The rooms were clean and up to our expectations, a good filling breakfast and a central and quiet location. Also helpful staff, thanks to David and the night receptionist (the blond guy whom I forgot to ask his name). I will definitely recommend your Hotel to others (actually I already did!) and we will definitely choose your Hotel again if we ever come back to Paris again. Thanks again and keep it up! Regards Sandro, Romina & Luca Zammit - Malta

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 37_year_old_couple
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely economical 2 star hotel within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower - in fact you can see it out of the hotel window! The room we had was beautiful and clean, and the room and en-suite bathroom both looked as though they had recently been refurbished. The power shower nearly blew us out of the bath!! The continental breakfast was wonderful and the staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful with directions and ordering taxis etc. If you look at a map of Paris as a clock face, this hotel is at approximately 8.00 o'clock and many attractions are at approximately 1.00 o'clock. However, the Metro is nearby or there are many buses to wherever you want to go. We chose to walk, and I'm glad we did because we saw many delights we would otherwise have missed. A brilliant short break - would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Paris, nice hotel, people, etc.”
Reviews.Author: GettingoutofLA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the Carina Hotel - we will stay here again! I read the reviews on many hotels, but this hotel was relatively close to the Eiffel Tower, the metro, nice grocery store (two blocks away) and restaurants. When we arrived in Paris, we were tired, the room was clean and the bed felt great (large bathroom). At breakfast we had more than enough food and the coffee was very good. The only trouble we actually had was the elevator. Since we were traveling to several countries over a three week period, my husband and I had three suitcases each. When we got on the elevator it was one person at a time. It wasn't too bad. One night we walked to the grocery store, purchased wine, cheese, bread and meat, when to our room, opened the window and watched the people - it was great. Also, the hotel arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport at 4AM, taxi was waiting for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to enjoy Paris!”
Reviews.Author: EsteeLauder
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much of this hotel as I knew it was pretty basic, but it definitely went beyond my expectations. The room was very clean and decorated tastefully. Breakfast was the typical "continental breakfast", which was included in the price. Good location to get around, friendly staff. No complaints at all! Would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Simple and close to town”
Reviews.Author: Rachael898
Reviews.Content: Very close to downtown Paris with ok people and smallish rooms. Our room was very basic but clean and nice. It’s on the smaller side but we never planned on spending much time in the hotel. Breakfast is basic but good. Very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlotte1974
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Gare De Nord station on Friday, then from there decided to take the metro to the hotel. Well it was easy peasy. About 20 min journey to the hotels nearest metro station charles michel. The metro stop is about 2 mins from the hotel. As you walk towards the hotel you can see the Eiffel Tower. You can walk to the Tower from the hotel, but it took us longer than 10 mins as we got a bit lost on the way. The room itself was quite small, the bathroom was bigger with two sinks and it had a shower. I would recommend to bring your own hairdryer though, as the one in the bathroom wasn't that great. Me and my sis stayed for 3 nights and the towels got changed everyday and loo paper restocked. The staff can appear a bit rude at first, but if you say morning to them, etc then they are cool with you. Location wise I thought it was ideal for getting around. Paris is quite small really and all the metro stops are quite near to one another. All in all the hotel served its purpose as a base to get around Paris. So if you don't mind basic then this could be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly waiter”
Reviews.Author: Katherine-7
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Paris with my husband and our two sons. We arrived at the Carina hotel after travelling by Eurostar and the metro and our first impressions were not brilliant. When booking the hotel the information on the internet said the stay would include free breakfast but the first thing said to us upon arrival was "the breakfast is not free". It may seem petty to get upset about this, but when you have a tight budget and you have based it on a free breakfast, that comment does not impress you right from the start. However, things could only get better. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The towels were changed each day. The bathroom was lovely. The hotel is in a very quiet but also convenient area, easy to get to from the Metro. Most of the staff were very friendly. I think the friendliest person was the waiter. He was so cheerful, chatty and helpfull. He provided us with a typical continental breakfast which, thankfully, was provided free of charge when we checked out. The waiter really made a difference to the whole atmosphere of the hotel. Considering the hotel is two star, I think it was very good and would recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Carina Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 9, rue de Ginoux | 15th Arr., 75015 Paris, France
